gui

Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.Frame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Frame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    A class that holds the main Swing elements of the game of Cluedo. This calls the 'GameOfCluedo' class which does the game logic. The graphical user interface is done in this class.
    Author:
    Aden Kenny and Simon Pope.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void newGame()
        Creates a new game of Cluedo. Used in the menu bar new game option.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        Ends the game of Cluedo. Called in cancelling opening windows (name input etc...) Or if a player wins.

        Asks the player to make a choice.
        Parameters:
        message - The question to be presented to the player.
        options - The options the player has to choose from.
        Returns:
